title: Civil rights movement: Mississippi Summer Project
brief_description: Depicts the Civil Rights movement and the Summer Project of 1963 in a single community in Mississippi and highlights vital issues, such as the freedom schools set up by volunteers, labour exploitation, police brutality, voter registration and the challenge of achieving racial peace. Edited from the Richard Beymer presentation - “A Regular bouquet”.
